intro: Orania sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sibuyan in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pinkish flowers with a subtle fragrance. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the mountainous regions of its native habitat. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
